title: COP16 on biodiversity: A source of national pride and a security challenge for Colombia
summary: Cali, the country's third-largest city, is preparing to welcome 12,000 participants.

title: Strikes intensify in Lebanon, Gaza and Israel after death of Hamas leader Sinwar
summary: Families of Israeli hostages call for a deal after Yahya Sinwar's killing. Missile and rocket fire continues unabated between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon.

title: With 16 days until Election Day, Harris urges Black churchgoers to vote in Georgia while Trump visits a fast-food
summary: Vice President Harris, who turned 60 Sunday, visited two Atlanta area churches as part of a push known as 'souls to the polls,' while the former Republican president made fun of her past student job at a McDonald's.

title: Moldovan president appears set to win first round of presidential race, but EU vote could be rejected according to partial results
summary: 'Criminal groups and hostile foreign forces have attacked our country with lies and propaganda,' said President Maia Sandu after about 90% of the votes had been counted.

title: After striking the Bahamas, Hurricane Oscar makes landfall in Cuba on third day of blackout
summary: Cuba's government said power would be reinstated for the majority of the country by Monday evening.

title: In Senegal, the president and prime minister's 'tradi-modern' style is very trendy
summary: Bassirou Diomaye Faye and Ousmane Sonko like to wear clothes inspired by the traditional boubou that also borrow a few details from Western fashion.

title: In Lebanon, Palestinians refugees have 'nothing left to lose'
summary: Following the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, representatives of different political camps in the Beddawi Palestinian refugee camp in northern Lebanon share a determination to continue 'resisting' Israel.

title: Europe's Euclid probe unveils the first pages of its sky atlas
summary: In revealing the initial piece of its grand map of the universe, the European Space Agency's mission is attempting to unravel the two great mysteries of cosmology: dark matter and dark energy.

title: Leclerc wins US Grand Prix and late penalty gives Verstappen 3rd place over Norris in title chase
summary: Charles Leclerc earned his third win of the season, Sunday, and gave Ferrari its first United States Grand Prix victory since 2018.

title: France says it has received assurances over sale of painkiller maker to US investment fund CD&R
summary: The proposed sale turned into a real political issue because Opella's products include Doliprane, the best-selling medicine in France.

title: Has France really become more right wing?
summary: Political scientist Vincent Tiberj, interviewed with ex-education minister Jean-Michel Blanquer, explains that the far-right Rassemblement National party's electoral surge doesn't reflect a rightward shift in French society.

title: Our selection of the 15 best apple tarts in France
summary: Cinnamon or caramel, rustic or very thin crust, vegan or sugar-free, here's our selection of the best apple-based desserts around the country.

title: Jewish leader Yonathan Arfi: 'For the first time since the Second World War, anti-Semitism is being fuelled at all levels of French society'
summary: The president of the Representative Council of French Jewish Institutions looks back at the shockwaves of the Hamas attack in Israel, and the anti-Semitic incidents that followed.

title: In Georgia, exile is the only option for many political opponents
summary: Many citizens are preparing to leave their country if the pro-Russian Georgian Dream party, in power since 2012, maintains its grip on power following the legislative elections on October 26.

title: At tribute for cyclist killed in Paris: 'What happened to Paul isn't an isolated case'
summary: Several hundred cyclists gathered at Place de la République on Saturday for a tribute to Paul Varry, the 27-year-old cyclist crushed by an SUV driver on Tuesday.

title: Back in the pool, French swimmer Léon Marchand wins three World Cup titles in Shanghai
summary: The French champion competed in swimming's short-course World Cup in Shanghai, in his first meet since taking the Paris Olympics by storm.

title: Harris and Trump prefer influencers and podcasters to mainstream media
summary: Both US presidential candidates have opted for minimal presence on TV and in the traditional press. Instead, they are focusing their campaigns on more targeted media, where they can avoid pushback.

title: Is Gen Z neglecting work, or are their older colleagues too quick to judge them?
summary: While numerous research studies are deconstructing stereotypes about new generations' relationship to work, the corporate world seems baffled as to how to manage its youngest employees.

title: COP16 on biodiversity: In Cali, countries will have to turn promises to halt nature's destruction into action
summary: The 16th World Biodiversity Conference opens on October 21 in Colombia, with the central issue being the implementation of the 2022 agreement, which aims to halt the loss of species and ecosystems by 2030.

title: Naomi Osaka's season is over because of injury
summary: The four-time Grand Slam singles champion said on Sunday, that she had ruptured abdominal muscles and will not play the Billie Jean King Cup finals in November.
